SentenceMakingQuestion.content:
You are in a meeting discussing the sales figures for the month. Your colleague notices some differences between the online report and the physical file. You are asked to explain the situation.



Sarah: 'Can you clarify why there are conflicting numbers in the report?'
SentenceMakingQuestion.solution: Yes, there seems to be a discrepancy between the online sales report and the physical records we have. We need to investigate this further.

SentenceMakingQuestion.content:
You are discussing the upcoming charity event with a colleague from another organization. You need to explain how you will work together to make it successful.



Sarah: 'How can we ensure the event runs smoothly and all details are coordinated?'
SentenceMakingQuestion.solution: I will liaise with the other organization to align our plans and make sure everything is organized effectively.

SentenceMakingQuestion.content:
You are talking to a colleague about a recent event you attended over the weekend. They ask you how your weekend was.



Colleague: 'Hey, how was your weekend? Do anything interesting?'
SentenceMakingQuestion.solution: I went to a family gathering on Saturday. It was a great success with lots of food and laughter.

SentenceMakingQuestion.content:

Emma: 'What are those green plants covering the pond?'
SentenceMakingQuestion.solution: Those green plants are algae. Algae can be found in both freshwater and marine environments.
